channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jerome Powell’s sudden bearishness on the jobs market is a welcome sign for Wall Street
item.description: "We’re not just an inflation-targeting central bank," Powell told the House Financial Services Committee on the second of two days of semi-annual testimony to Congress. “We also have an employment mandate."

item.title: Goldman says investors should start shifting out of cash. Here's where it sees opportunity
item.description: Goldman Sachs believes it is a "real probability" that the Fed will start to cut rates in September.

item.title: Inspectors use TikTok to reveal ‘shoddy’ new million-dollar homes
Astronauts say they’re confident Boeing’s space capsule will get them safely back to Earth, even though it’s had multiple mechanical failures and they should’ve returned weeks ago
item.description: The test flight should have lasted eight days, ending on June 14. Today is July 10.

item.title: HubSpot shares plunge 11% on report that Alphabet is shelving interest in acquiring software company
item.description: Alphabet has reportedly shelved its interest in acquiring HubSpot months after the companies were reportedly in talks.

item.title: Privatization is taking over Medicare. Here's how much it cost taxpayers.
What cognitive tests can show—and what they can’t
item.description: And presidents aside, does the average adult need one?

item.title: Senators strike bipartisan deal for a ban on stock trading by members of Congress
item.description: Nancy Pelosi dropped her resistance to a proposed ban on stock trading by legislators in 2022, allowing the policy push to pick up steam on Capitol Hill.

item.title: These bitcoin miners are expanding into AI. Why they may be a good buy.
Top economist: Buyers and sellers should brace themselves for the 6% mortgage rate reality
item.description: Mortgage rates won’t be going back down to the historical lows seen throughout the pandemic, the National Association of Realtors’ chief economist said.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Intuit, AMD, LegalZoom.com, Baidu and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: CrowdStrike leads selloff in software stocks as ‘FOMO’ chip trade roars back
Viral photo of $444 Trader Joe’s receipt sparks new debate over grocery inflation
This cement startup says it goes beyond net zero to true zero carbon emissions
item.description: Sublime Systems uses chemicals instead of heat and other minerals instead of limestone.

item.title: AMD looks to ‘move fast’ and swipe at Nvidia with its purchase of Silo AI
